summary:
Albus: I’d like to spice things up.
Scorpius: You know I’m allergic to chilli 
Albus: I meant spice things up in the bedroom....
body:
Albus: I’d like to spice things up.

Scorpius: You know I’m allergic to chilli

Albus: I meant spice things up in the bedroom.

Scorpius: Al, it doesn’t matter what room it is. I’m still allergic to chilli…

Scorpius: Al, it doesn’t matter what room it is. I’m still allergic to chilli…

summary: One of my favorite Harry Potter AU settings will always be GoF!Harry coming back from the First Task and walking, tired and...
body: One of my favorite Harry Potter AU settings will always be GoF!Harry coming back from the First Task and walking, tired and bloody, into the party in the Gryffindor common room and immediately being all “fuck you guys very much, you can all take a long walk off the Astronomy Tower” because literally hours earlier almost all of them were dead set against him but now that he’s done something impressive again they’re all cheering and Fuck That Noise™

tags: fantastic beasts and where to find them
summary:
I’ve had a thought about the difficulties of being an LGBT+ witch or wizard and having a relative who is a legilimens.
I’m not...
body:
I’ve had a thought about the difficulties of being an LGBT+ witch or wizard and having a relative who is a legilimens.

I’m not sure what the wizarding acceptance is of LGBT+ witches/ wizards (as we have no representation in canon at all; don’t get me started on that ball game), but if it’s similar to the muggle society, and being LGBT+ is considered by many people to be wrong, surely this would pose an issue for some LGBT+ witches/ wizards in strict/ conservative/ unaccepting families, due to the occurrence of legilimens? Obviously, being a powerful legilimens is quite rare, but if you had one in your family it would be extremely hard to hide from them that you are LGBT+, especially if you had it on your mind a lot before you came out (as I did). Surely this could be quite dangerous and scary for the said witch/ wizard? I mean, I’ve experienced panic when members of my family as much as glanced at my phone, just imagine what having a family member being able to read your mind would be like.

summary: 『O』『U』『T』『R』『E』『A』『C』『H』 Part One This started out as my own prompt: Harry has figured out that the only way to really get under...
caption:
『O』『U』『T』『R』『E』『A』『C』『H』
Part One

This started out as my own prompt: Harry has figured out that the only way to really get under his aunt and uncle’s skin was to tell them he was gay. Now that they found out he can’t actually do magic outside of school, they’re beginning to question what else he’s lied about. They just so happen across Draco Malfoy in muggle London a few days later, and Harry decides he can kill two birds with one stone - make the Dursley’s uncomfortable, and watch Malfoy squirm at the same time. Only… it doesn’t quite go as planned…

I’ve changed some things, but the basic plot is there!

Disclaimers: I’m not an author. I’m a housewife living in America. Don’t be too hard on me. Obviously, I own nothing, or Drarry would have been canon.


Part One

        The muggle outreach program had been his idea. It wasn’t that Harry was particularly proud of that fact, although there had been a certain sense of satisfaction when Hermione had beamed up at him. No, this reminder played on loop for one simple purpose – to remind him not to hex the Dursley’s. It seemed like an innocent enough initiative. It would be a way for those that participated in the war to reach out to the muggles that had been – unknowingly – affected. Hermione had thought the idea brilliant, Ron had thought it a better alternative to fixing up the school before returning for their eighth and final year. The Weasley’s didn’t say as much, but none of them were quite ready to return to the place where they had lost Fred. Perhaps if Harry had known exactly which muggles he would be saddled with, he would have gladly signed up for manual labor.

Although he and Dudley had an amicable goodbye, Harry’s Uncle Vernon and Aunt Petunia didn’t seemed to want to forget that fact that it was Harry that had drove them away from their home. Never mind the sadistic wizard that wanted them all dead. At first, it had almost been amusing… familiar. Perhaps the war had done something to Harry’s brain if he listened in on Uncle Vernon’s complaining with anything other than contempt. Although it had been the first time he had seen them since his daring escape from number 4 Privet Drive, they had apparently seen him before then. Harry had thought it safe – to date in muggle London. After all, most wizards kept to themselves these days, and those that dared venture into the realm of muggles tended to stick to less crowded areas. Maybe that’s why Harry had grown complacent enough to bring Andrei Petrov to dinner there. It hadn’t been serious, not on Harry’s part anyway. He was fresh out of the war and simply looking to explore the feelings he had pushed aside for years. Between his aunt and uncle’s bigoted views and the threat on his life, Harry had been weary to explore his sexuality. Andrei was nice enough, and more than pleasant to look at. He had arrived with the other good will ambassadors from Durmstrang after the war. It had lasted three weeks and ended after a public yet questionable romp in an alley before Andrei departed. Although the relationship (if it could be called that) was short, it had confirmed two things for Harry. The first, was that he most certainly was bi-sexual. The second… well, perhaps he wasn’t as safe in muggle London as he liked to hope.

To Uncle Vernon’s credit, he waited until Harry’s second visit to bring up the fact that he and Aunt Petunia had seen him kissing Andrei. Harry waited for the shame and embarrassment to come – like it always had when they judged him with those beady eyes of theirs – but it didn’t. Dudley said nothing on the subject, but Harry noticed he kept his distance. As if he would catch something. Harry had managed to avoid his Uncle’s half-hearted words of warning by tending to Aunt Petunia’s garden.

By the fourth visit to the Dursley’s, Harry was forgetting why he ever wanted to help them in the first place. The program was set up for six visits per muggle family, so it was almost over… another fact Harry had to mentally repeat numerous times. At least now, walking down the streets of the busiest shopping district in London, Uncle Vernon’s condescending tone was low and manageable. Part of Harry almost wished he was still seeing Andrei, if only to have a way of getting Uncle Vernon to shut up. Long gone were the days where Harry strived to be loved and accepted by the Dursley’s. Now, he just wondered how he could make this whole ordeal as uncomfortable for them as they had made it for him.

As Aunt Petunia worked to coddle her ever-reddening husband, Harry’s attention was stolen by a familiar flash of white. It had been months since he had seen any of the Malfoy’s. He had spoken at their trial – at least on behalf of Narcissa and Draco. The last he heard from the Profit was that Lucius was looking at life in Azkaban. Harry wasn’t sure if it was the shock of seeing Draco Malfoy amongst the busy muggles going about their day, or simply the sight of him alone, but his feet froze. Hermione had mentioned something about Malfoy being forced by the Ministry to join the program, but he didn’t think for a moment that they would actually allow a death eater near muggles. He looked better than he did at the trial, but that wasn’t saying much. Harry remembered thinking that it was the only time Draco Malfoy had ever appeared small to him. Yes, he was an annoying git, and he hardly ever played fair, but after the war he was just… broken.

Harry watched as Draco spoke in a low voice to a young boy, pointing to something in a shop window before brushing a strand of hair behind his ear. It was longer now – Harry realized. It seemed Malfoy had forgone his trademark style of slicking his hair to skull and simply let it grow out. Harry wanted to come up with a quip – if only for the fact that Malfoy had always made fun of his own unkempt hair – but he found he couldn’t. The look suited Malfoy. It softened some of his sharp edges. Or perhaps it was the fact that Harry had only ever seen hatred on Malfoy’s features. It wasn’t until those sharp, mercury eyes shot to him that Harry realized he was walking over. His step faltered at the realization, but he could hardly stop now.

“Malfoy.” Harry greeted with a small nod, trying to pretend that this was all just perfectly normal.

“Potter.” Malfoy’s voice was cool an assessing, but his eyes moved curiously over Harry’s face. His top lip twitch in a mockery of the sneer that was once so at home on Malfoy’s mouth, making Harry wonder if he was as broken as he had looked at the Wizengamot.

“It’s not as if we…,“ Uncle Vernon’s voice seemed to roar over the murmur of hundreds of bustling shoppers as the Dursley’s descended on them. For a moment, Harry had forgotten they were there. He seemed to remember Harry just as Harry was remembering him. “What’s this then, boy?” He gruffed, his eyes narrowing in a way that reminded Harry all too well of his younger years. “You’re supposed to be helping us, not socializing!” His eyes never left Draco, as if he believed if he stared hard enough, he’d be able to see the magic.

“Is this your boyfriend then, Harry?” He was sure that Dudley had meant it to be an insult of sorts, but there was a genuine curiosity in his tone. Harry opened his mouth to reply that of course Malfoy was not the type he would date when he noticed his aunt and uncle go stiff. For the first time since these meetings started, they were quiet. Malfoy might not have what he had in mind, but he would do well enough.

“Remember that life-debt you owe me, Malfoy?” Harry mumbled, his bright jade eyes skidding over to Draco’s. “Consider it paid in full after this…” Before Malfoy could protest, or maybe hex him, Harry grabbed either side of his sharp jaw and hauled him forward until their lips met in the middle.

It was hardly a scandalous kiss, though Harry had a feeling that if Malfoy decided to haul back and punch him, it would certainly seem that way. Nonetheless, he heard Aunt Petunia’s gasp and Uncle Vernon’s sputter behind him. When it became clear that Malfoy wasn’t going to break his nose (again), Harry stepped into him more fully. It was only when Harry’s calloused fingers landed on the fine silk of Malfoy’s shirt that it sunk in. He was kissing Draco - sodding - Malfoy. It wasn’t that Malfoy was bad looking - if you were into that whole pointy, toned, blond haired, and otherworldly eyes thing…. Harry wasn’t. At all. So what if Malfoy was fit? So what if he tasted like something akin to treacle tart? So what if he was kissing Harry back… wait, what!? As Harry’s gasped lightly in surprise, he felt Malfoy’s thin lips curve up around his. Those boney fingers that usually only formed fists in his presence dug into the sides of Harry’s too-large jumper before rounding to cup Harry’s arse. He was sure he heard Aunt Petunia faint behind him, but the last thing he wanted to do was turn and check.

This had all gone sideways rather quickly…

Buy me a coffee  || Drop me an ask

Harry wasn’t sure if it was the shock of seeing Draco Malfoy amongst the busy muggles going about their day, or simply the sight of him alone, but his feet froze. Hermione had mentioned something about Malfoy being forced by the Ministry to join the program, but he didn’t think for a moment that they would actually allow a death eater near muggles. He looked better than he did at the trial, but that wasn’t saying much. Harry remembered thinking that it was the only time Draco Malfoy had ever appeared small to him. Yes, he was an annoying git, and he hardly ever played fair, but after the war he was just… broken.

Harry watched as Draco spoke in a low voice to a young boy, pointing to something in a shop window before brushing a strand of hair behind his ear. It was longer now – Harry realized. It seemed Malfoy had forgone his trademark style of slicking his hair to skull and simply let it grow out. Harry wanted to come up with a quip – if only for the fact that Malfoy had always made fun of his own unkempt hair – but he found he couldn’t. The look suited Malfoy. It softened some of his sharp edges. Or perhaps it was the fact that Harry had only ever seen hatred on Malfoy’s features. It wasn’t until those sharp, mercury eyes shot to him that Harry realized he was walking over. His step faltered at the realization, but he could hardly stop now.

“Malfoy.” Harry greeted with a small nod, trying to pretend that this was all just perfectly normal.

“Potter.” Malfoy’s voice was cool an assessing, but his eyes moved curiously over Harry’s face. His top lip twitch in a mockery of the sneer that was once so at home on Malfoy’s mouth, making Harry wonder if he was as broken as he had looked at the Wizengamot.

“It’s not as if we…,“ Uncle Vernon’s voice seemed to roar over the murmur of hundreds of bustling shoppers as the Dursley’s descended on them. For a moment, Harry had forgotten they were there. He seemed to remember Harry just as Harry was remembering him. “What’s this then, boy?” He gruffed, his eyes narrowing in a way that reminded Harry all too well of his younger years. “You’re supposed to be helping us, not socializing!” His eyes never left Draco, as if he believed if he stared hard enough, he’d be able to see the magic.

“Is this your boyfriend then, Harry?” He was sure that Dudley had meant it to be an insult of sorts, but there was a genuine curiosity in his tone. Harry opened his mouth to reply that of course Malfoy was not the type he would date when he noticed his aunt and uncle go stiff. For the first time since these meetings started, they were quiet. Malfoy might not have what he had in mind, but he would do well enough.

“Remember that life-debt you owe me, Malfoy?” Harry mumbled, his bright jade eyes skidding over to Draco’s. “Consider it paid in full after this…” Before Malfoy could protest, or maybe hex him, Harry grabbed either side of his sharp jaw and hauled him forward until their lips met in the middle.

It was hardly a scandalous kiss, though Harry had a feeling that if Malfoy decided to haul back and punch him, it would certainly seem that way. Nonetheless, he heard Aunt Petunia’s gasp and Uncle Vernon’s sputter behind him. When it became clear that Malfoy wasn’t going to break his nose (again), Harry stepped into him more fully. It was only when Harry’s calloused fingers landed on the fine silk of Malfoy’s shirt that it sunk in. He was kissing Draco - sodding - Malfoy. It wasn’t that Malfoy was bad looking - if you were into that whole pointy, toned, blond haired, and otherworldly eyes thing…. Harry wasn’t. At all. So what if Malfoy was fit? So what if he tasted like something akin to treacle tart? So what if he was kissing Harry back… wait, what!? As Harry’s gasped lightly in surprise, he felt Malfoy’s thin lips curve up around his. Those boney fingers that usually only formed fists in his presence dug into the sides of Harry’s too-large jumper before rounding to cup Harry’s arse. He was sure he heard Aunt Petunia faint behind him, but the last thing he wanted to do was turn and check.

This had all gone sideways rather quickly…

trail.content_raw:
『O』『U』『T』『R』『E』『A』『C』『H』
Part One

This started out as my own prompt: Harry has figured out that the only way to really get under his aunt and uncle’s skin was to tell them he was gay. Now that they found out he can’t actually do magic outside of school, they’re beginning to question what else he’s lied about. They just so happen across Draco Malfoy in muggle London a few days later, and Harry decides he can kill two birds with one stone - make the Dursley’s uncomfortable, and watch Malfoy squirm at the same time. Only… it doesn’t quite go as planned…

I’ve changed some things, but the basic plot is there!

Disclaimers: I’m not an author. I’m a housewife living in America. Don’t be too hard on me. Obviously, I own nothing, or Drarry would have been canon.


Part One

        The muggle outreach program had been his idea. It wasn’t that Harry was particularly proud of that fact, although there had been a certain sense of satisfaction when Hermione had beamed up at him. No, this reminder played on loop for one simple purpose – to remind him not to hex the Dursley’s. It seemed like an innocent enough initiative. It would be a way for those that participated in the war to reach out to the muggles that had been – unknowingly – affected. Hermione had thought the idea brilliant, Ron had thought it a better alternative to fixing up the school before returning for their eighth and final year. The Weasley’s didn’t say as much, but none of them were quite ready to return to the place where they had lost Fred. Perhaps if Harry had known exactly which muggles he would be saddled with, he would have gladly signed up for manual labor.

Although he and Dudley had an amicable goodbye, Harry’s Uncle Vernon and Aunt Petunia didn’t seemed to want to forget that fact that it was Harry that had drove them away from their home. Never mind the sadistic wizard that wanted them all dead. At first, it had almost been amusing… familiar. Perhaps the war had done something to Harry’s brain if he listened in on Uncle Vernon’s complaining with anything other than contempt. Although it had been the first time he had seen them since his daring escape from number 4 Privet Drive, they had apparently seen him before then. Harry had thought it safe – to date in muggle London. After all, most wizards kept to themselves these days, and those that dared venture into the realm of muggles tended to stick to less crowded areas. Maybe that’s why Harry had grown complacent enough to bring Andrei Petrov to dinner there. It hadn’t been serious, not on Harry’s part anyway. He was fresh out of the war and simply looking to explore the feelings he had pushed aside for years. Between his aunt and uncle’s bigoted views and the threat on his life, Harry had been weary to explore his sexuality. Andrei was nice enough, and more than pleasant to look at. He had arrived with the other good will ambassadors from Durmstrang after the war. It had lasted three weeks and ended after a public yet questionable romp in an alley before Andrei departed. Although the relationship (if it could be called that) was short, it had confirmed two things for Harry. The first, was that he most certainly was bi-sexual. The second… well, perhaps he wasn’t as safe in muggle London as he liked to hope.

To Uncle Vernon’s credit, he waited until Harry’s second visit to bring up the fact that he and Aunt Petunia had seen him kissing Andrei. Harry waited for the shame and embarrassment to come – like it always had when they judged him with those beady eyes of theirs – but it didn’t. Dudley said nothing on the subject, but Harry noticed he kept his distance. As if he would catch something. Harry had managed to avoid his Uncle’s half-hearted words of warning by tending to Aunt Petunia’s garden.

By the fourth visit to the Dursley’s, Harry was forgetting why he ever wanted to help them in the first place. The program was set up for six visits per muggle family, so it was almost over… another fact Harry had to mentally repeat numerous times. At least now, walking down the streets of the busiest shopping district in London, Uncle Vernon’s condescending tone was low and manageable. Part of Harry almost wished he was still seeing Andrei, if only to have a way of getting Uncle Vernon to shut up. Long gone were the days where Harry strived to be loved and accepted by the Dursley’s. Now, he just wondered how he could make this whole ordeal as uncomfortable for them as they had made it for him.

As Aunt Petunia worked to coddle her ever-reddening husband, Harry’s attention was stolen by a familiar flash of white. It had been months since he had seen any of the Malfoy’s. He had spoken at their trial – at least on behalf of Narcissa and Draco. The last he heard from the Profit was that Lucius was looking at life in Azkaban. Harry wasn’t sure if it was the shock of seeing Draco Malfoy amongst the busy muggles going about their day, or simply the sight of him alone, but his feet froze. Hermione had mentioned something about Malfoy being forced by the Ministry to join the program, but he didn’t think for a moment that they would actually allow a death eater near muggles. He looked better than he did at the trial, but that wasn’t saying much. Harry remembered thinking that it was the only time Draco Malfoy had ever appeared small to him. Yes, he was an annoying git, and he hardly ever played fair, but after the war he was just… broken.

Harry watched as Draco spoke in a low voice to a young boy, pointing to something in a shop window before brushing a strand of hair behind his ear. It was longer now – Harry realized. It seemed Malfoy had forgone his trademark style of slicking his hair to skull and simply let it grow out. Harry wanted to come up with a quip – if only for the fact that Malfoy had always made fun of his own unkempt hair – but he found he couldn’t. The look suited Malfoy. It softened some of his sharp edges. Or perhaps it was the fact that Harry had only ever seen hatred on Malfoy’s features. It wasn’t until those sharp, mercury eyes shot to him that Harry realized he was walking over. His step faltered at the realization, but he could hardly stop now.

“Malfoy.” Harry greeted with a small nod, trying to pretend that this was all just perfectly normal.

“Potter.” Malfoy’s voice was cool an assessing, but his eyes moved curiously over Harry’s face. His top lip twitch in a mockery of the sneer that was once so at home on Malfoy’s mouth, making Harry wonder if he was as broken as he had looked at the Wizengamot.

“It’s not as if we…,“ Uncle Vernon’s voice seemed to roar over the murmur of hundreds of bustling shoppers as the Dursley’s descended on them. For a moment, Harry had forgotten they were there. He seemed to remember Harry just as Harry was remembering him. “What’s this then, boy?” He gruffed, his eyes narrowing in a way that reminded Harry all too well of his younger years. “You’re supposed to be helping us, not socializing!” His eyes never left Draco, as if he believed if he stared hard enough, he’d be able to see the magic.

“Is this your boyfriend then, Harry?” He was sure that Dudley had meant it to be an insult of sorts, but there was a genuine curiosity in his tone. Harry opened his mouth to reply that of course Malfoy was not the type he would date when he noticed his aunt and uncle go stiff. For the first time since these meetings started, they were quiet. Malfoy might not have what he had in mind, but he would do well enough.

“Remember that life-debt you owe me, Malfoy?” Harry mumbled, his bright jade eyes skidding over to Draco’s. “Consider it paid in full after this…” Before Malfoy could protest, or maybe hex him, Harry grabbed either side of his sharp jaw and hauled him forward until their lips met in the middle.

It was hardly a scandalous kiss, though Harry had a feeling that if Malfoy decided to haul back and punch him, it would certainly seem that way. Nonetheless, he heard Aunt Petunia’s gasp and Uncle Vernon’s sputter behind him. When it became clear that Malfoy wasn’t going to break his nose (again), Harry stepped into him more fully. It was only when Harry’s calloused fingers landed on the fine silk of Malfoy’s shirt that it sunk in. He was kissing Draco - sodding - Malfoy. It wasn’t that Malfoy was bad looking - if you were into that whole pointy, toned, blond haired, and otherworldly eyes thing…. Harry wasn’t. At all. So what if Malfoy was fit? So what if he tasted like something akin to treacle tart? So what if he was kissing Harry back… wait, what!? As Harry’s gasped lightly in surprise, he felt Malfoy’s thin lips curve up around his. Those boney fingers that usually only formed fists in his presence dug into the sides of Harry’s too-large jumper before rounding to cup Harry’s arse. He was sure he heard Aunt Petunia faint behind him, but the last thing he wanted to do was turn and check.

This had all gone sideways rather quickly…

blog.name: bitingdownpromo
blog.title: Biting Down
blog.description: The year is 2027. The wizarding community is tearing itself apart as danger lurks around every corner; the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power. Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance?

summary:
the electronics of your heart...
 The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in...
caption:
the electronics of your heart…

The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in squib births, the wizarding world is tossed into chaos concerning the loss of magical heritage. The renegades vow to protect what’s left of magical blood without caring about the damage along the way. More and more wixen go missing, including the Weasleys’ own Dominique. The Ministry fights within itself as Percy Weasley and Hermione Granger battle for the position of Minister of Magic, tearing the fabric holding wizarding society together.

see how fast they fall apart…

Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance? Whether you flee or bite down and take the heat, the next great war is coming and the outcome is up to you. Welcome to Biting Down.

home | plot | rules | wanted connections | character suggestions | application

Our roleplay currently has many canon characters available, such as Victoire Weasley, Louis Weasley, James Potter, Scorpius Malfoy, and both Scamander twins. We also welcome original characters, with lots of surnames available from canon!

blog.name: mymindsmadness
blog.title: My Mind's Madness
blog.description: 29 (until further notice) ⇾ Female ⇾ Pan but happily (monogamously) married ⇾ RL Pansy Parkinson. Don't @ Me.

summary: Even more things the HP (Drarry) fandom has accepted as canon
title: Even more things the HP (Drarry) fandom has accepted as canon
body:
again, I know that not everyone believes this stuff, it’s just for fun and more geared towards Drarry shippers. Thanks to everyone that contributed!!


ϟ Hermione knows when Harry is getting some. She just knows.

ϟ Seamus and Dean were a power gay couple.

ϟ Draco was redeemed.

ϟ Draco speaks French (I couldn’t remember if this was actually canon, but I couldn’t find any official info saying he did)

ϟ Hermione is black

ϟ Harry is half Indian on his father’s side

ϟ Tempus is a spell

ϟ Wolfstar was canon

ϟ James shipped it

ϟ Everyone had a thing for Oliver Wood

ϟ But he was too in love with Quidditch to notice

ϟ Seamus and Dean were a power gay couple.

ϟ Draco was redeemed.

ϟ Draco speaks French (I couldn’t remember if this was actually canon, but I couldn’t find any official info saying he did)

ϟ Hermione is black

ϟ Harry is half Indian on his father’s side

ϟ Tempus is a spell

ϟ Wolfstar was canon

ϟ James shipped it

ϟ Everyone had a thing for Oliver Wood

ϟ But he was too in love with Quidditch to notice

title: Exceeding Expectations
description:
by alexandeer

Hattie Potter is nothing what people expected her to be. She quickly figures out people expect her to be a certain way and does the complete opposite. She plans to take down everyone who hurt her and her family.

blog.name: doewept
blog.title: drown the stars
blog.description: snape aes sideblog // not an rp blog // please note that i don't reblog mental illness or trauma posts here unless i've experienced them myself. i mean no harm.

summary: snape loves the musician grace jones, for all kinds of reasons. a huge highlight to him is that she's authentic as hell. she...
body:
snape loves the musician grace jones, for all kinds of reasons. a huge highlight to him is that she’s authentic as hell. she uses her strangeness as power. she turned how she was abused and bullied as a child into this positive energy, and this was something he’d never seen anyone do before.

he’d always thought it impossible to rebuild after trauma, especially to turn around and become someone your abusers would have feared.

it started in the 80s, when he made one of his occasional trips to the muggle world to look for records (dude hates CDs). he saw one with this gorgeous person on the cover who looked sort of otherworldly and impossible, and when he saw how stunning she looked on this album, he actually said out loud, “are you kidding me??”

(this cover – “Nightclubbing”, 1981)
